name: Acceptance Criteria - Location of works identified in accordance with the project drawings and specification.
2 - Identification of any services and structure

Acceptance Criteria - The contractor shall identify any services within the work area and shall erect and maintain temporary barriers and boarding’s etc to protect the services and structure during construction.

Acceptance Criteria - Unsuitable, surplus material, Contaminated excavated material and legacy waste shall be spoiled to locations directed by the Superintendent with all waste material sent offsite to be documented and tracked as required by state regulations.
Acceptance Criteria - The stability of the ground to be excavated shall be confirmed prior to construction commencing.
○ All work methods shall be carried out to the satisfaction of the Superintendent.
Acceptance Criteria - Any loose soft spots or loose materials shall be excavated and spoiled to the approved stockpile area.
○ The floors and sides of excavations shall be trimmed to the lines, levels, grades and batters shown on the Drawings and within the tolerances specified.

Acceptance Criteria - Excavations shall always be drained. If, during excavation, natural ground water is encountered, the Contractor shall immediately notify the Superintendent and shall ensure that relevant water quality sampling and testing is undertaken to demonstrate suitability of this release. If required, de-watering shall be carried out in a safe and efficient manner and in accordance with the Site licence requirements and approved management plans.
○ The point of surface water release will be to existing receptors or to a site determined by the principal.
Acceptance Criteria - Lot close out, Material Compliance Checked, NCR’s Closed.
We confirm that the above works have been undertaken in accordance with the contract specification and the project quality plan:
This is to certify that the construction has overall compliance with the specification
